description: Kernel from which all DiSSCo DOI FDO profiles are derived

fdoProfile.description: PID to a machine readable description of the attributes in the FDO record

fdoRecordLicenseId.description: The licence for the FDO record, required to be always public domain

fdoRecordLicenseName.description: Human readable version of the FDO Record license

digitalObjectType.description: PID to a description of the Type of digital object that defines the metadata, bit sequences (if any) and operations for the object

digitalObjectName.description: Name of the object type for humans

pid.description: The PID of which the FDO record is part, in DiSSCo this is a Handle or DOI. It is recommended to store this pid also in the local collection management system for the specimen.

pidIssuer.description: In case of a DOI this is a PID for the DOI Registration Agency

pidIssuerName.description: Human-readable name of the PID issuer

pidRecordIssueDate.description: Date the PID record was created

pidRecordIssueNumber.description: Starts with 1 and is incrementally increased by 1 every time the pid record is updated. Compatible with DOI schema requirements.

pidStatus.description: A PID is considered to have a lifecycle, PID status indicates the status in the life cycle, e.g. draft, active, retired. PID statuses are described further in the PID infrastructure design.

tombstoneText.description: A reason why the Digital Object was tombstoned
examples: This is a duplicate of XXX
This object was made by mistake

hasRelatedPid.description: The PIDs of the object the tombstoned object is related to

pid.description: The PID of the related object

relationshipType.description: The type of relationship between the tombstoned object and the related object

tombstoneDate.description: Timestamp the Digital Object was tombstoned and no longer active.

10320/loc.description: XML document describing location(s) of the resource

issuedForAgent.description: In the case of a digital specimen, this is a PID for DiSSCo as the agent responsible for serving the digital specimen object

referentName.description: In the case of a digital specimen this is the name for the object in the collection, which can be anything from a taxon name to a collection number. In the case of a media object, it is the media url without https://.

specimenHost.description: ROR or, in absence of a ROR, Wikidata Qnumber for the administrative organisation hosting the specimen. Same as: Latimer Core identifierSource.

specimenHostName.description: Name for the administrative organisation as derived from ROR or Wikidata at the point of creating the FDO record.

normalisedPrimarySpecimenObjectId.description: For internal processing purposes only to make a local identifier globally unique. This is the primarySpecimenObjectId if it is globally unique or a combination of ROR ID string, source system ID string, primarySpecimenObjectId if it is a proprietary identifier.

resolvable.description: whether or not the identifier is resolvable

topicOrigin.description: Highest-level terms identifying the fundamentals of the activities, in which context the objects in the collection were collected.

topicDomain.description: High-level terms providing general domain information with which the objects are associated.

topicDiscipline.description: Overarching classification of the scientific discipline to which the objects within the collection belong or are related.

topicCategory.description: Countable things (objects) served as a more detailed classification of each of the disciplines.

markedAsType.description: TRUE if the specimen is marked as type with a stamp or label.
